attributes.action: Raise the issue of Human Rights violations in India with Prime Minister Modi.
attributes.additional_details:
Sir Salman Rushdi has described the situation of Civil Liberties and Freedom of Expression in India as "a degree of thuggish violence". (http://bit.ly/1VRyq7A). More background can be seen here - 
http://bbc.in/1QrbB3L.  Mr Rushdie said, "There are attacks on ordinary liberties, the ordinary right of assembly, the ordinary right to organize an event in which people can talk about books and ideas freely and without hostility, that seems to be in real grave danger in India today."
attributes.background: In recent times, India has seen a growing intolerance for the civil liberties and freedom of expression. Many rationalists have been killed and others feel threatened. Near Delhi,  a mob lynched an old man over rumours that he had beef in their home. PM Modi kept silent sending wrong signals.
